etymology.description: Depicts an upside-down human figure (大 inverted) with a horizontal stroke -> emphasizes inversion and opposition -> Original form of 逆(逆) (nì, "contrary")
etymology.interpretation: 屰(屰) (nì, "disobedient") presents an upside-down human figure, symbolizing opposition or contrary behavior. The added horizontal line emphasizes the inversion, fitting the meaning of being disobedient or contrary.

examples.chinese: 那个屰的孩子经常顶撞父母(那個屰的孩子經常頂撞父母)。
examples.pinyin: Nàgè nì de háizi jīngcháng dǐngzhuàng fùmǔ.
examples.english: That disobedient child often talks back to his parents.

examples.chinese: 学生屰(學生屰)，老师十分苦恼(老師十分苦惱)。
examples.english: The student is disobedient, and the teacher is very troubled.
